column1: What is Moldovan national music like?
column2: Moldovan national music is either really sad or really happy, has a lot of brass and is closely similar to Romanian music actually.

column4: Is Moldovan music sad or happy?

column1: What is the national language of Moldova?
column2: Moldova’s national language is Romanian, but everyone also speaks Russian.
column3: What language do you speak in Moldova?
column4: Do you speak Romanian in Moldova?
column5: Do you speak Russian in Moldova?

column1: How come Moldovans speak both of those languages?
column2: Moldova was originally a region of Romania, and then we became a part of the Russian Empire and then the Soviet Union, and so after we became independent we were left with two languages.
column3: Tell me about the history of Moldova.
column4: Why did you grow up speaking two languages?
column5: Why do you speak Romanian and Russian?

column1: What language do you speak in your family?
column2: My family speaks both languages! My mom’s first language is Russian and my dad’s is Romanian, so it’s a nice mix.
column3: Do your parents speak both Romanian and Moldovan?
column4: Did you grow up speaking both Romanian and Moldovan?
column5: Were Romanian and Moldovan both spoken in your home?

column1: What language do your grandparents speak?
column2: My dad’s parents speak Romanian, but my mom’s parents speak in Ukrainian to me.
column3: Do your grandparents also speak Romanian and Moldovan?
column4: Do your grandparents know any other languages?
column5: How do you communicate with your grandparents?

column1: What languages do you speak in school?
column2: We have more Romanian than Russian schools, but we do have both.
column3: What languages do schools in Moldova teach?
column4: Do schools in Moldova teach both Romanian and Russian?
column5: What kind of schools do you have in Moldova?

column1: How is it like studying at NYUAD?
column2: Studying at NYUAD is lovely! Good-quality people, a lot of things to do on campus, great weather and small classes with experts in the field!

column4: Are you happy you came to NYUAD?
column5: What are the best things about NYUAD?

column1: What’s the hardest major at NYUAD?
column2: Maybe engineering, because they have to take a lot of science classes that don’t directly relate to their major, but anything can be hard if you have high standards for your work.
column3: Which major do you think is the most difficult?
column4: Which students have to work hardest at NYUAD?
column5: Which major is the most challenging at NYUAD?

column1: What’s the best part about NYUAD?
column2: The fact that you meet people from all over the world and get to participate in amazing projects, like me right now being an AVATAR!

column4: What is so great about NYUAD?

column1: How do you overcome writer’s block?
column2: By working every day. If you sit to write music once a day for at least 30 mins, you’ll get into the habit of having to do something even if you think you’re not inspired. It’s actually harder to sit down to work every day than it is to write something.
column3: What do you do when you have no inspiration?
column4: How do you get inspiration for your work?
column5: How do you manage to write continuously?

column1: How do you stay motivated when you're not satisfied with your own work?
column2: You do so by implementing your music into projects as opposed to doing it only for yourself. Show your music to the world - whether it’s performing it on stage, making music for a short film or showing it to your friends, and you’re likely to get some positive feedback to keep you going and some constructive criticism to improve your work!
column3: Where do you find motivation for your work?
column4: How do you get feedback on your work?
column5: How do you share your work?

column1: What purpose do you want your music to serve?
column2: To make the world more beautiful and to make people feel something.
column3: What objective does your music have?
column4: What objective does your music have?
column5: What do you want to accomplish through your music?

column1: What do you love the most about music?
column2: I love that it always carries emotions with it. Whether it’s anger, happiness, sadness, love, it makes you feel something, and I love feeling things.
column3: What do you love the most about your field?
column4: What do you love the most about your major?
column5: Why are you so passionate about music?
